description: Students examine classical issues in ethics and theory of value: the nature of moral judgments; theories of moral obligation and value; the concept of moral responsibility; and the relation of morality to science, religion and law. Prerequisite: two courses in philosophy, one of which must be either 235 or 236, or permission of the department chair.
name: Sem: Eth/Theory/Value
prerequisites: Prerequisite: two courses in philosophy, one of which must be either 235 or 236, or permission of the department chair.
title: Studies in Ethics and Theory of Value
